intro: Bidens odorata var. chilpancingensis, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with prominent white markings, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a native plant in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and aesthetic value.
